law.catch_line: If a child support lien is not satisfied or released, the Administration may bring an action in a ci...

text.section: If a child support lien is not satisfied or released, the Administration may bring an action in a circuit court to enforce the lien.

The following persons shall be made parties to the proceeding:
each person who has a recorded lien on the property that is sought to be subjected to the proceedings under this section; and
each person who claims a right or interest in the property that is sought to be subjected to the proceedings under this section.

The court, acting without a jury, shall:
adjudicate all matters involved in the proceedings; and
determine the merits of all claims or liens.

If the claim of the obligee is established, the court may order:
a sale of the property or rights to property; and
a distribution of any proceeds of sale to the Administration or obligee.
